summary: In this context, Buta-1,3-diene is mentioned as a volatile organic compound (VOC) that contributes to indoor air pollution, alongside carbon particles and other carcinogenic pollutants. While both Buta-1,3-diene and carbon are implicated in air pollution and associated health risks, the relationship is primarily contextual, focusing on their roles as pollutants rather than a direct interaction or specific biochemical relationship.
